keyPolicies.policyDescription: Active campaigner for the NHS, no NHS closures, dementia friendly initiatives.
Action on climate change and investment in renewable energies.
Fair wages in a fair economy, against austerity.
Prevent local airport expansion to avoid negative outcomes for citizens of Southampton.

mentions.candidate: Katherine Barbour is an active campaigner for the NHS, air quality and the environment, and against austerity. Locally she is campaigning to prevent the airport expansion, which will have negative outcomes for the citizens of Southampton.

issues.economy: Fair wages in a fair economy, against austerity.
issues.environment: Air quality, action on climate change, investment in renewable energies.

community.content: Locally she is campaigning to prevent the airport expansion, which will have negative outcomes for the citizens of Southampton.

leaflet.personalStatement: Katherine is a firm believer in real democracy through proportional representation; a cleaner, brighter future through investment in renewable energies and public transport; free education and healthcare for all and fair wages in a fair economy. As a recent project manager in the NHS, she understands the importance of healthy ageing for older persons and has a particular interest in those people living with dementia, whether they are in the community or in health settings. Across Wessex, she supported over 150 GP surgeries to become dementia friendly.

politicalExperience.achievements: Supported over 150 GP surgeries to become dementia friendly.
